content.webTitle: Cumani filly in top gear for Guineas

fields.headline: Cumani filly in top gear for Guineas
fields.bodyText: Gossamer, with her big-race jockey Jamie Spencer aboard, impressed in a piece of work over seven furlongs at Newmarket on Saturday and had her 1,000 Guineas odds cut to 5-2 from 11-4. Luca Cumani, the filly's trainer, said: "The weather has been quite kind and she has come on nicely and everything has gone according to plan - so far, there are still eight days to go." With unsettled weather forecast this week, the Bedford House handler is not too concerned about underfoot conditions for next Sunday's Classic. He added: "She's won on a fast surface and on soft at Ascot and she's done most of her work on fast ground." Mick Channon's Queen's Logic is market leader at 13-8, while some interest has also been shown in Sir Michael Stoute's Alasha and Hill's now have her on offer at 11-1 from 12-1. On the colts front, Mark Johnston's Sagitta 2,000 Guineas hope Love Regardless also had a workout over the weekend. The son of Storm Bird, winner of a Newcastle maiden on his only start to date, galloped at Ripon yesterday under big-race jockey Kevin Darley. Love Regardless had a run out last week at the same track after which the Middleham trainer thought the colt needed another spin to put him spot on for Saturday's Classic. Johnston said. "We are very happy with him. He still had a blow after it so he needed it. " · You've read the piece, now have your say.
